PageTitle: igmp snooping query max-response-time (Bridge domain view)
FuncDef:
The igmp snooping query max-response-time command sets the maximum time for a downstream host to respond to a querier.
The undo igmp snooping query max-response-time command restores the default setting. The igmp snooping query max-response-time command sets the maximum time for a downstream host to respond to a querier. The undo igmp snooping query max-response-time command restores the default setting. By default, the maximum time for a downstream host to respond to a querier is 10s. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum time for a downstream host to respond to a querier.
The value ranges from 1 to 25, in seconds.
